title: Advanced Visualization Features in Atlas
description: A guide to leveraging advanced visualization features in Nomic Atlas for deeper data insights.

overview.purpose: To help users maximize the functionality of Nomic Atlas by utilizing advanced visualization tools for exploring, filtering, and analyzing complex datasets.
use_cases: Exploring large-scale datasets with clustering and dimensionality reduction.
Applying dynamic filters to refine data views.
Customizing map interactions for presentations or reports.

key_features.description: Automatically groups similar data points into clusters based on embedding similarity or metadata.
benefits: Highlights patterns and relationships between data points.
customization_options: Highlight specific clusters for detailed analysis.

key_features.description: Allows users to filter data points based on metadata or embedding properties.
key_features.example_use_case: Filter customer feedback by sentiment score or date range.

key_features.description: Reduces high-dimensional data to 2D or 3D for visualization.
benefits: Preserves meaningful relationships between data points.

key_features.description: Enables users to interact with visualized data maps.
controls: Pan across the map to focus on specific areas.
Click on individual data points to view detailed metadata.
key_features.example_use_case: Presenting a zoomable map of Reddit comments grouped by topic.

key_features.description: Add notes or highlights to specific data points or regions on the map.
use_cases: Annotate outliers or anomalies for further investigation.

steps.title: Upload Data to Atlas
steps.description: Ensure your dataset is uploaded to Nomic Atlas using the `/v1/data/upload` API endpoint.

steps.title: Enable Visualization Features
steps.description: Customize visualization settings in the Nomic Atlas interface or API.

example_request.curl: curl -X POST 'https://api-atlas.nomic.ai/v1/maps/settings' -H 'Authorization: Bearer <API_KEY>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"settings": {"clustering": true, "filtering": true, "dimensionality_reduction": "UMAP"}}'

steps.title: Interact with the Map
steps.description: Use the Atlas web interface or API to explore and analyze the visualized data.
example_interactions: Apply filters to focus on specific data subsets.
Zoom into clusters to identify sub-patterns.
Click on points to view metadata and annotations.

python_script.description: Automate advanced visualization settings using Python.

visualization_tips: Experiment with clustering granularity to uncover different levels of data grouping.
Use dimensionality reduction methods like UMAP for faster and more interpretable results.
Combine filters to refine data views and focus on specific insights.
Leverage annotations to highlight key findings or anomalies.
notes: Advanced features like clustering and dimensionality reduction may require additional computation time for large datasets.
Refer to the Nomic Atlas API documentation for detailed customization options.
Annotations can be saved and exported for use in reports or presentations.
